questions.text: A 38-year-old woman, gravida 1 para 0, comes to the office for her first prenatal visit. Her last menstrual period was 12 weeks ago. The patient has had nausea and vomiting occasionally over the past few weeks but no other symptoms. Supine blood pressure is 142/96 mm Hg and 138/92 mm Hg on repeat measurement 15 minutes later. Physical examination shows an anxious woman with mild bilateral ankle edema and an enlarged uterus. A urinalysis dipstick is negative for protein and glucose. The patient returns to the office for a blood pressure measurement a week later and her blood pressure is 152/106 mm Hg. Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis in this patient?

A 30 years old primigravida with 32 weeks of gestation with microcytic hypochromic anaemia of 6 gm%. She is hemodynamically stable but has history of easy fatiguability for 4-5 months. She is also giving history of passage of worms in stool. What should be the best line of management in her?

A 35 years old G2P1L1 has 24 weeks of gestation. She is a known case of rheumatic heart disease with history of valve replacement surgery done 10 years back for which she is on oral anti-coagulant therapy. Her PT (INR) is 2.0. What is the next best plan of action regarding her anticoagulation?

options.label: A
options.text: Continue oral anti coagulation till active labour

options.label: B
options.text: Switch over to inj. Heparin immediately

options.label: C
options.text: Switch over to inj. Heparin at 36 weeks

options.label: D
options.text: Give vitamin k since this is overdosage of oral anticoagulation

questions.correct_answer: C. Switch over to inj. Heparin at 36 weeks

questions.text: A 32 years old nulliparous patient had history of 3 abortions in last 3 years. All her abortions were spontaneous and were of 8-9 weeks. What is the possible cause amongst the following?

options.label: C
options.text: Balanced translocation in patient and partner

questions.correct_answer: C. Balanced translocation in patient and partner

questions.text: One of the following is not the clinical feature of abruptio placenta?

options.label: A
options.text: It is more common in hypertensive patients

options.label: B
options.text: It is more common in smokers

options.label: C
options.text: USG is diagnostic in most cases

options.label: D
options.text: PV examination can be done in abruptio placenta

questions.correct_answer: C. USG is diagnostic in most cases

questions.text: One of the following is not associated with placenta previa:
One of the following is not true regarding hormones in pregnancy:

options.label: A
options.text: Progesterone production is not dependent on foetus

options.label: B
options.text: Estriol formation requires raw material from fetal origin

options.label: D
options.text: HPL is directly proportional to the size of placenta

questions.text: A 41-year-old had a baby with Down syndrome 10 years ago. She is anxious to know the chromosome status of her fetus in a current pregnancy. The test that has the fastest lab processing time for karyotype is
Which type of pelvis is associated with persistent OP

Which of the following describes the reproductive history of a pregnant woman who is 32 weeks pregnant with a previous twin delivery at 34 weeks where one baby died after 1 day and other is alive and healthy and a still birth at 32 weeks
Following a cesarean birth, contraindications for a trial of labor in a subsequent pregnancy include all except
questions.correct_answer: B. Lack of prior vaginal delivery

questions.text: Dose of dexamethasone and interval
What are the findings in the image shown below
questions.correct_answer: B. Yolk sac and amniotic sac

questions.text: Which of the following is not a component of bishops score
All the following can be findings in a woman who was followed up after suction evacuation for molar pregnancy and has the following chest X ray image except
A primigravida with preeclampsia at 37 weeks is being induced with oxytocin. The following graph is seen during her monitoring. Which of the following will not be done for her management ?
Which of the following findings would deter you from offering this patient a trial of breech delivery?
Which of the following are not risk factors for postpartum hemorrhage (PPH)?

options.label: C
options.text: Prolonged use of oxytocin during labor

options.label: D
options.text: Prolonged exposure to magnesium during labor

questions.text: A 22-year-old woman, gravida 1, para 0, at 15 weeks of gestation by her LMP, presents to you for an ultrasound examination to confirm her due date. Which of the following measurements on the fetus is the best at predicting her actual due date?
The spiegelberg’s criteria in the diagnosis of ovarian pregnancy are all except

options.label: A
options.text: Tube on the affected side must be intact.

options.label: B
options.text: The gestation sac must be in the position of the ovary

options.label: C
options.text: The gestation sac is connected with infundibulopelvic ligament

options.label: D
options.text: Ovarian tissue must be found on its wall on histological examination.

questions.correct_answer: C. The gestation sac is connected with infundibulopelvic ligament

questions.text: A 40-year-old G3P2 obese patient at 37 weeks presents for her routine OB visit. She has gestational diabetes that is controlled with diet. She reports that her fasting and postprandial sugars have all been within the normal range. Her fetus has an estimated fetal weight of 3kg by Leopold maneuvers. Which of the following is the best next step in her management?

options.label: A
options.text: Administration of insulin to prevent macrosomia

options.label: B
options.text: Cesarean delivery at 39 weeks to prevent shoulder dystocia

options.label: D
options.text: Kick counts and routine return visit in 1 week

questions.correct_answer: D. Kick counts and routine return visit in 1 week

questions.text: A 31-year-old G1P0 woman at 39 weeks and 4 days presents to the labor and delivery unit, with regular contractions occurring every 3 to 5 minutes. Her contractions last 30 to 90 seconds. You determine her membranes have ruptured and admit her for active management of labor. The first stage of labor: 1) Includes an active and latent phase 2) Ends when the cervix has completely dilated 3) Begins with the onset of Braxton Hicks contractions Answer using the code
Which of the following muscle is not cut in episiotomy
In which of the following conditions in an Rh negative pregnancy Anti D will not be given 1) Negative ICT 2) MCA PSV >1.5 3) Cordocenetsis Answer using the code given below
Match the teratogens with their corresponding findings in pregnancy

A 31-year-old G2P1 woman at 39 weeks’ gestation complains of painful uterine contractions that are occurring every 3 to 4 minutes. Her cervix has changed from 1-cm dilation to 2-cm dilation over 3 hours. Which one of the following management plans is most appropriate?

Primigravida with Rh negative pregnancy presents for her antenatal visit at 16 weeks and was advised ICT she follows up with anti D antibody titer of 1:4. What is the most appropriate next step in the management of this patient?

options.label: A
options.text: Schedule an amniocentesis for amniotic ?uid bilirubin at 16 weeks

options.label: D
options.text: Schedule UBS as soon as possible to determine fetal blood type

questions.text: A woman comes to the physican for a prenatal visit. Examination reveals that her uterus is considerably larger than her gestational age would predict. An ultra-sound examination is ordered and reveals that she has polyhydramnios. Which of the following congenital defects of the fetus would be most likely to be associated with this abnormality?

With respect to the following image what is incorrect

options.label: D
options.text: Risk of recurrence after one affected fetus is 10%

questions.correct_answer: D. Risk of recurrence after one affected fetus is 10%

questions.text: Perineal tear grade 3b refers to

options.label: A
options.text: Tear of mucosa and muscle and external sphincter more than 50%

options.label: B
options.text: Tear of mucosa muscle and external sphincter less than 50%

options.label: C
options.text: Tear of mucosa muscle and both internal and external sphinter

options.label: D
options.text: Tear of mucosa, muscle external sphincter and rectum

questions.correct_answer: A. Tear of mucosa and muscle and external sphincter more than 50%

questions.text: Among the drugs used for AMTSL which statement is not true

options.label: C
options.text: Oxygen requirement of tissues increases by 20%

options.label: D
options.text: Cardiac output Reaches maximum by 32 weeks

questions.text: A 27 year old primigravida has eclampsia, loading dose of mgso4 in Pritchard’s regimen to be given to her should be:

options.label: A
options.text: 4gm i.v. In 20 % dilution plus 5gm im in each buttock (50%dilution)

options.label: B
options.text: 4gm i.v in 50% dilution plus 5gm im in each buttock (20% dilution)

options.label: C
options.text: 5gm i.v in 25% dilution plus 10gm im in any buttock (50% dilution)

options.label: D
options.text: 2gm i.v. In 50% dilution plus 5gm im in any buttock (50% dilution

questions.correct_answer: A. 4gm i.v. In 20 % dilution plus 5gm im in each buttock (50%dilution)

questions.text: A 24-year-old primigravid woman, who plans to breastfeed, decides to have a home delivery. Immediately after the birth of a 4.1-kg newborn, the patient experiences massive hemorrhage from extensive vaginal and cervical lacerations. She is brought to the nearest hospital in shock. Over the course of 2 hours, nine units of blood are transfused, and the patient’s blood pressure returns to a reasonable level. A hemoglobin value the next day is 7.5 g/dL, and three more units of packed red blood cells are given. The most likely late sequela to consider in this woman is which of the following?

A 24-year-old G2P1001 woman is at 34 weeks’ gestation and noted to be icteric. She also has nausea and vomiting and malaise. A diagnosis of acute fatty liver of pregnancy is made, and the obstetrician recommends immediate delivery. Which of the following is most consistent with acute fatty liver of pregnancy?

options.label: B
options.text: H ypoglycemia requiring multiple D50 injections

questions.correct_answer: B. H ypoglycemia requiring multiple D50 injections

Which of the following clinical conditions is not an indication for induction of labor?

questions.text: A woman undergoes sonographic evaluation for uterine –size date discrepancy. AFI turned out to be 36 and the image is shown below. which of the following is appropriate for evaluation of this patient

A lady after delivery was noted to have postpartum haemorrhage. On examination her uterine fundus was firm but lower segment was atonic for which she was given oxytocin and hemabate. Despite this she continued to bleed and a whole blood transfusion was started and bakri balloon tamponade was put. Despite this she continues to bleed. Her PR is 124 bpm and BP is 80/60mmhg. You perform a laparotomy and see atonic uterus . which of the following is a suitable next step in this situation
For postmenopausal HRT which statement is true

options.label: A
options.text: Increases cardiovascular risk if used before 60 years

questions.text: A 45 year old post menopausal women presents with vaginal bleeding transvaginal ultrasound reveals are endometrial thickness of 8.0 mm the next step is the management should be :

A 43-year-old woman is referred from her general practitioner (GP) with painful periods. She says that her periods have always been quite heavy and painful but that in the last 2–3 years they have become almost unbearable. She bleeds every 24 days and the period lasts for 7–9 days with very heavy flow from day 2 to day 6. On bimanual palpation the uterus is approximately 10 weeks size, soft and bulky. She is tender on palpation but there is no cervical excitation, adnexal tender- ness or adnexal masses. The following is the ultrasound image what is the diagnosis

questions.text: A 56-year-old G3P3 woman is referred to the urogynecology clinic for urinary leakage by her primary care provider (PCP). She has leaked urine when coughing, sneezing, and jogging for the last 3 years Which of the following is an appropriate surgical choice for her?

A 21-year-old woman presents with left lower quadrant pain. An anterior 7-cm ?rm adnexal mass is palpated. She undergoes cystectomy and the following is the tumour seen. What percentage of these tumors are bilateral?
Five patients present for contraceptive counselling, each requesting that an IUD be inserted. Which of the following is a contraindication to the use of an IUD?

options.label: A
options.text: Abnormalities of the uterus resulting in distortion of the cavity

options.label: C
options.text: History of Chlamydia infection treated 4 months ago

options.label: D
options.text: History of loop electrocautery excision procedure of the cervix

questions.correct_answer: A. Abnormalities of the uterus resulting in distortion of the cavity

questions.text: A 50-year-old woman is diagnosed with cervical cancer. Which lymph node group would be the first involved in metastatic spread of this disease beyond the cervix and uterus?

A 50 year old woman presents with intermenstrual bleeding for last 6 months, bleeding is not very heavy. A transvaginal ultrasound is done which shows the following image . What is then likely diagnosis of this patient?
What is the probable diagnosis of a 37 year old woman presenting with heavy menstrual bleeding for last 6 months and the following hvsteroscopic finding
Match the letters A,B,C,D with the hormones they represent in the menstrual cycle
questions.correct_answer: D. A- PROGESTERONE B-ESTROGEN C-LH D-FSH

options.label: A

questions.text: In an amenorrheic patient who has had pituitary ablation for a craniopharyngioma, which of the following regimens is most likely to result in an ovulatory cycle?

options.label: C
options.text: Human menopausal or recombinant gonadotropin followed by human chorionic gonadotropin (hCG)

questions.correct_answer: C. Human menopausal or recombinant gonadotropin followed by human chorionic gonadotropin (hCG)

questions.text: A 18-year-old G0P0 woman is told by her doctor that there is a strong probability that her gonads will turn malignant. She has not had her menses yet. She has Tanner stage I breast development. Which of the following describes the most likely diagnosis?
A 30 year old lady presents for evaluation of infertility. She has a BMI of 23 and has Worsening dysmenorrhea over last 2-3 years. The following is the laparoscopic image what is the diagnosis
All the following are correct lab associations with this syndrome except
What is typical pubertal sequence?
questions.correct_answer: D. Accelerated growth, thelarche, pubarche, menarche

questions.text: A 46-year-old patient comes in with a problem visit for a complaint of an intermittent painless mass on her vulva near the introitus. It seems to be aggravated by intercourse, but usually goes away on its own. You examine her and find a 3 cm nontender mass in the area described What treatment would you recommend for this patient?
questions.correct_answer: A. Biopsy of the cyst wall

questions.text: You are seeing a patient who has been diagnosed with the following. You counsel her that she is at highest risk for which of the following complications of pregnancy?

An 18-year-old nulligravid woman presents to the student health clinic with a 4-week history of yellow vaginal discharge. She also reports vulvar itching and irritation On genitourinary examination, vulvar and vaginal erythema is noted along with a yellow, frothy, malodorous discharge with a pH of 6.5 and the following appearance of cervix . The addition of 10% KOH to the vaginal discharge does not produce an amine odor. Wet prep microscopic examination of the vaginal swabs is performed. What would you expect to see under microscopy
What findings would you expect to see on laboratory testing in a patient with POI?

options.label: A
options.text: Elevated TSH, normal FSH, low estradiol

options.label: B
options.text: Normal TSH, elevated FSH, normal estradiol

options.label: C
options.text: Normal TSH, elevated FSH, low estradiol

options.label: D
options.text: Elevated TSH, elevated FSH, elevated estradiol

questions.correct_answer: C. Normal TSH, elevated FSH, low estradiol

questions.text: A couple comes to you for evaluation of infertility. The patient’s FSH level is 40 mIU/mL, and the estrogen level is less than 20 pg/mL. You repeat the lab tests in 4 weeks, and the findings are similar. You have the patient and her husband come back to clinic and gently give them the diagnosis. They have many questions of what this means in terms of their ability to achieve a pregnancy. You let them know that their best chances of achieving a pregnancy are with

options.label: B
options.text: In vitro fertilization (IVF) with the patient’s own eggs

questions.text: Medications used in the treatment of idiopathic central precocious puberty include
A 19-year-old patient presents to your office with primary amenorrhea. She has normal breast and pubic hair development, but the uterus and vagina are absent. Diagnostic possibilities include
Which of the following pubertal events in girls is not estrogen dependent?

A 25-year-old woman presents to you for routine well-woman examination. She has had two normal vaginal deliveries and is healthy. She has no gynaecologic complaints. Her last menstrual period was 3 weeks ago. During the pelvic examination, you notice that her left ovary is enlarged to 5 cm in diameter. Which of the following is the best recommendation to this patient?

options.label: C
options.text: Return to the office in 1 to 2 months to recheck the ovaries

options.label: D
options.text: Schedule a CT s can of the pelvis

questions.correct_answer: C. Return to the office in 1 to 2 months to recheck the ovaries

questions.text: A 57-year-old menopausal patient presents to your office for evaluation of postmenopausal bleeding. She is morbidly obese and has chronic hypertension and adult onset diabetes. Which of the following is the best treatment option for this patient?
